issues.description:
GuessTheRandomNumberChallenge.guess(uint8) (../../../tmp/user1/contracts/swc-120-guess-the-number.sol#20-26) sends eth to arbitrary user
	Dangerous calls:
	- msg.sender.transfer(2000000000000000000) (../../../tmp/user1/contracts/swc-120-guess-the-number.sol#24)

issues.description:
GuessTheRandomNumberChallenge.guess(uint8) (../../../tmp/user1/contracts/swc-120-guess-the-number.sol#20-26) uses timestamp for comparisons
	Dangerous comparisons:
	- n == answer (../../../tmp/user1/contracts/swc-120-guess-the-number.sol#23)
issues.swc_title: Block values as a proxy for time

issues.description:
Deprecated standard detected answer = uint8(keccak256()(block.blockhash(block.number - 1),now)) (../../../tmp/user1/contracts/swc-120-guess-the-number.sol#13):
	- Usage of "block.blockhash()" should be replaced with "blockhash()"

issues.code: Không có source code :(, FE tự điền ứng với sourcemap nhé

issues.description:
Any sender can withdraw Ether from the contract account.
Arbitrary senders other than the contract creator can profitably extract Ether from the contract account. Verify the business logic carefully and make sure that appropriate security controls are in place to prevent unexpected loss of funds.
